newsitem.title: CHINA: China interbank market rates (CHIBOR) mostly down.
newsitem.headline: China interbank market rates (CHIBOR) mostly down.

text.p: Following is the China Interbank Offered Rate (CHIBOR) for Thursday issued by the official Xinhua news agency on behalf of the People's Bank of China, the central bank.
The figures represent weighted averages and not closing prices and are annual percentage rates.
Volume fell to 1.5 billion yuan from 3.4 billion on Wednesday, with the 90-day contract the most active.

Traders said rates moved in a narrow range in slow trading, with both state banks and short-term financial centres, money brokerages run by the central bank, reducing their trading volume with the approach of the year-end.

But they said the rates were likely to go up slightly in the short term because many financial institutions need to borrow money to cover a shortage of funds, with the central bank soon expected to conduct its annual audit of the institutions.
